paragraph0.bullet_point0: Meet the requirement for open access to articles and other research results by depositing in an open knowledge archive
paragraph0.bullet_point1: Publish reports, student theses and other material produced at the institution
paragraph0.intro: By using NVA, Norwegian research institutions are able to:

description.paragraph1: NVA is also being developed for use in reporting scientific publishing to the Ministry of Knowledge and the Ministry of Health and Care Services (NVI reporting), and for other research administrative tasks.
description.paragraph2: Sikt is the data processor. The individual institution is the data controller and registers and maintains its own content in the service, and configures distribution rules for published resources (articles, reports, datasets, etc.). The service also receives content from other data sources.
description.paragraph3: NVA supports delayed publication of resources. This means that a registration can be completed so that metadata about the resource is published, while the resource does not become openly accessible until a specified date. The service does not allow the processing of sensitive personal data.
description.paragraph4: NVA will make the institution's open content available via open interfaces, with the intention of making it known and searchable to the outside world, and promoting indexing in search engines and search portals.
description.paragraph5: Although NVA is established and used by several institutions, the service will be in continuous development throughout its lifetime. Institutions that do not have a knowledge archive can contact <0>Sikt</0> to start using NVA as a pilot institution.

about.footer_text: The service is provided by Sikt — Norwegian Agency for Shared Services in Education and Research. Sikt provides shared services to the Norwegian knowledge sector.
about.short_description: The Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA) gathers information about Norwegian research, and makes research results and research information openly accessible.

authorization.accept_terms_to_create_user: I consent to being created as a user in NVA
authorization.cancel_create_user_text: You must create a user to proceed. If you cancel, you will be logged out. Do you wish to cancel?
authorization.create_user_info: As a user, you will be available to anyone who wants to add an author or contributor to results.
authorization.expired_token_info: Your session has expired and you have been logged out. Continue as an anonymous user or log in again.
authorization.forbidden_description: You are not authorized to view the content on this page. Contact the administrator if this is not correct.
authorization.registration_not_published: This registration has not been published yet.

add_employee.missing_nin_description: <0>We need you to confirm the identity of the person without a national identity number such as a birth number or D-number.</0><0>To distinguish the person from others with similar names, at least one research result associated with this person must be registered.</0><0>Note that you are not only confirming the person for your institution, but also for other institutions in the system.</0><0>Whoever confirms the exception will therefore be visible in the system as documentation.</0><0>Do you confirm that this person exists and has contributed to at least one research result at your institution?</0>
add_employee.missing_nin_title: Confirm identity for person without national identity number
add_employee.no_matching_persons_found: If you can't find the correct person in the Person Registry, you can create a new person profile.
add_employee.only_confirmed_user_qualify_for_nvi: Only persons with confirmed identity can be included in the NVI report.

merge_candidate.merge_details_2: Data from NVA is displayed on the right. Metadata from the import candidate is displayed on the left and often has better data quality. You can individually select what you want to include.

doi.doi_information_bullet_points: $t(common.doi_long) is a persistent identifier.|Simplifies citations of publications.|Metadata about the result is shared internationally.|Visiblity of result increases.|Contributes to fulfill the FAIR principles.|Supports open research.
doi.doi_information_bullet_points_2: The service has support for assigning $t(common.doi_long) to results.|The institution that assigns $t(common.doi_long) becomes the publisher of the result.|Thorough checking of metadata, contents of files and licences is necessary before assigning $t(common.doi_long). Incorrect metadata is time-consuming to correct afterwards.

publish_strategy.registrator_publishes_metadata_descripti: Files and licences must be approved by the Curator before they become publicly available.
publish_strategy.registrator_publishes_without_curator: The registrar publishes without approval from Curator
publish_strategy.registrator_publishes_without_curator_de: The institution determines who is the Registrar.

retention_strategy.creator_can_override_rrs_text: <0>The institution has made it possible for the registrar to choose not to follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS). By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S.</0></0> <1>In NVA, the registrar removes RRS from the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article. The RRS checkbox appears by clicking on the arrow icon under the accepted version of the file. By removing the check from RRS, the selected licence on the file is removed and the licence must be selected again.</1>
retention_strategy.curator_can_override_rrs_text: <0>The publishing curator has access to set that files do not follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS).</0> <0>If the registrar does not wish to follow the institution's rights retention strategy (RRS), look at the terms for not following RRS on the information page about the institution's rights retention strategy.</0> <1>By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S</0>.</1>
retention_strategy.customer_has_no_rrs: <0>The institution has not provided a rights retention strategy (RRS) in NVA.</0> <0>Without an institutional rights retention strategy, it is up to the registrar to set the correct licence on the accepted version of files in the registration of scientific articles.</0> <1>It is up to the registrar to potentially mark whether the publication should follow an RRS. By following a rights retention strategy (RRS), scientific articles become openly available immediately without embargo. <0>See cOAlition S's website for information on RRS and Plan S.</0></1> <0>If the publication is funded by an actor that requires adherence to RRS (ref. Plan S), then RRS must be set. In NVA, the registrar sets RRS on the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article. The RRS checkbox appears by clicking on the arrow icon under the accepted version of the file. By checking the box for RRS, the licence for the file is set to CC-BY.</0>
retention_strategy.customer_has_rrs_text: <0>The institution has provided a rights retention strategy (RRS) in NVA.</0> <0>The CC-BY licence is set when you choose the accepted version of the file in the registration of a scientific article in NVA.</0>v
retention_strategy.possible_not_to_follow_rrs: Possible to not follow the institution's rights retention policy
retention_strategy.rrs_info_page: The institutions' information page about rights policy

footer.about_nva: About The Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA)
footer.about_nva_text: The Norwegian Research Information Repository (NVA) collects publications and other research results, and makes them openly available in a common national solution. This makes results from Norwegian research available in a single service.
footer.about_sikt_text: Sikt enters into an agreement with each institution about the use of the service. Our customers are typically universities, colleges, research institutes and organizations in the health sector.

description.cc0: The person who has associated a work with this deed has, to the extent the law allows, declared this work to be in the public domain by waiving all copyright and related rights that they had to the work.
description.cc_by:
Share — copy, distribute and transmit the work in any medium or format. Adapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material for any purpose, including commercially.

You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the licence, and indicate if changes have been made.
description.cc_by_nc:
Share — copy, distribute and transmit the work in any medium or format. Adapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material for any purpose.

You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the licence, and indicate if changes have been made.
You may not use the material for commercial purposes.
description.cc_by_nc_nd:
Share — copy, distribute and transmit the work in any medium or format.

You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the licence, and indicate if changes have been made.
You may not use the material for commercial purposes.
If you remix, transform, or build upon the material, you may not distribute the modified material.
description.cc_by_nc_sa:
Share — copy, distribute and transmit the work in any medium or format.
Adapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material.

You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the licence, and indicate if changes have been made.
You may not use the material for commercial purposes.
If you remix, transform, or build upon the material, you must distribute your contributions under the same licence as the original.
description.cc_by_nd:
Share — copy, distribute and transmit the work in any medium or format for any purpose, including commercially.

You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the licence, and indicate if changes have been made.
If you remix, transform, or build upon the material, you may not distribute the modified material.
description.cc_by_sa:
Share — copy, distribute and transmit the work in any medium or format.
Adapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material for any purpose, including commercially.

You must give appropriate credit, provide a link to the licence, and indicate if changes have been made.
If you remix, transform, or build upon the material, you must distribute your contributions under the same licence as the original.
description.rights_reserved:
This work is published here for personal use, and only in accordance with the publisher's rules and conditions for the use of self-archived versions.

"Publisher's conditions" is not a licence, but a statement that some rights are reserved for the publisher, the author, and possibly others. The reader must clarify for themselves what the law allows them to do with this work, beyond reading it.

helper_text_modal.detailed_paragraph_1: If you have an ORCID, you are encouraged to link it to your researcher profile. If you do not have an ORCID, you can create it at the same time as you link it to your researcher profile.
helper_text_modal.detailed_paragraph_2: Some publishers and funders require you to have an ORCID, in order to submit manuscripts and applications for funding respectively. If they do not require it, you as a researcher should demand it. Your research results will become easier for everyone to cite correctly and there is less work afterwards. Linking ORCID to your researcher profile is an offer, not a requirement. You can withdraw your link whenever you want under MY PAGE | Personal information.
helper_text_modal.introduction: ORCID provides you with a permanent, digital identifier that you own and control, distinguishing you from other researchers. By linking your ORCID to your researcher profile, the NVA will be able to import more of your publications in the future, faster and more accurately.
helper_text_modal.link: For more information go to ORCID

orcid.orcid_description: If you link your ORCID, it will be easier to identify you

If you wish to revoke Sikt's approval to read your ORCID, please go to your ORCID profile.

my_profile.remove_profile_picture_info: Are you sure you want to remove the profile picture?

about.heading: About this privacy statement
about.paragraph: This privacy statement describes how the data controller handles your personal data in the service. The purpose of this privacy statement is to inform you about what personal data is processed, how it is processed, who is responsible for the processing, what rights you have, and who you can contact.

automatic_case_processing.heading: Automated case processing
automatic_case_processing.paragraph0: The personal data related to system users will not be subject to automated case processing or profiling.
automatic_case_processing.paragraph1: Open personal data related to resources registered in the service may be profiled by other services that copy and/or index information in the service, but are not profiled as part of the service.

section0.heading: Data controller
section0.paragraph: The institution is the data controller for personal data in the service and is the primary contact point for users.

section1.heading: Data processor
section1.paragraph: Sikt develops and manages the service on behalf of the data controller, and has the role of data processor.

section2.intro: Contact information for Sikt user support:

disclosure_of_data.heading: Disclosure of your personal data to third parties
disclosure_of_data.paragraph0: Disclosure or export of data is defined as any release of data other than to one's own system/processing, or to the data subject themselves or someone who receives data on their behalf.
disclosure_of_data.paragraph1: Personal data related to users are not transferred to countries outside the EU/EEA.
disclosure_of_data.paragraph2: The service is operated on servers in the EU/EEA.

paragraph3.intro: Your personal data will be disclosed to Sikt, who is the provider of the service, and to its subcontractors:

table.caption: Overview of subcontractors who may receive personal data

row0.col0: Supplier in framework agreement for AWS through the GÉANT collaboration
row0.col1: Cloud management and backup for Sikt's direct services

row1.col1: Cloud management and backup for Sikt's direct services

row2.col1: Provides Feide, for authenticating users of the services

disclosure_of_data.paragraph4: Employees of the subcontractors, with a legitimate need, will have customized access to your personal data in order to provide on-site maintenance, user support and any correction of errors in the service.
disclosure_of_data.paragraph5: Open personal data linked to the resources are shared openly with external services. This includes search services such as Oria and OpenAIRE, as well as search engines that index data via the web pages — e.g. Google, Baidu, Bing and others.

paragraph6.intro: See the following table for the service's integrations:

row1.col0: Import of material to NVA from external services
row1.col2: Sources defined by the data controller

row2.col0: Export of metadata from NVA to external service
row2.col1: Export of metadata for resources to other services for presentation or cross-registration. For example, Oria to facilitate retrieval.
row2.col2: Sikt for Oria. Sources defined by the data controller.

row3.col1: The registrar can request the assignment of a Document Object Identifier (DOI) to a resource in NVA. This will cause selected metadata to be published in DataCite — a source regularly indexed by search engines.

row4.col1: Establish a link to the authority register for authorization of the author, editor, supervisor and other creator or contributor registered in the service. To facilitate unambiguous registration and retrieval.

row5.col1: Establish a link to ORCID register for authorization of the author, editor, supervisor and other creator or contributor registered in the service. To facilitate unambiguous registration and retrieval.

purpose.heading: The purpose of personal data processing in the service
purpose.paragraph: The service processes various types of persons for the following purposes:

row0.col1: Archive administrator, editor, curator. Typically, employees of the institution.
row0.col2: Administration of the service, including maintenance of content and configuration of access to functions and content. Administrative users must be registered with an identity to get rights in the service.

row1.col1: Registrar. Persons affiliated with the institution who have logged in to the service.
row1.col2: Registration of content in the service. Users must be registered with an identity, and link to the authority register for authors, to get rights in the service.

row2.col1: Persons or services that access the service without logging in. IP addresses will be logged.
row2.col2: Anonymous users are given access to open resources in the service. The service logs necessary information to prevent misuse and to generate aggregated statistics on the use of the resources.

row3.col0: Bibliographic data — persons linked to the registered resource
row3.col1: Author, editor, supervisor or other creator or contributor to a resource registered in the service.
row3.col2: Cataloguing, crediting and accountability of the persons behind the resource.

row4.col0: Bibliographic data — persons referred to in the resource
row4.col1: Personal data referred to in the content of the published resource
row4.col2: Making the published resource available. The content manager, together with the data controller, must ensure the privacy of the resource before it is published in the service.

registered_personal_data.heading: Registered personal data, legal basis and storage time
registered_personal_data.paragraph0: Personal data related to the user account in the service requires consent as a legal basis, cf. the <0>Act on the Processing of Personal Data (Personal Data Act), GDPR Article 6</0> no. 1 letter a.
registered_personal_data.paragraph1: Registered personal data about authors and other individuals associated with the resource or identified in the resource are covered by the <0>Data Protection Act (Personal Data Act), GDPR Article 6</0> No. 1 letter f — to perform a task of legitimate interest.
registered_personal_data.paragraph2: The service does not allow the processing of sensitive personal data. In cases where the users themselves can enter information in comment fields and the like, the user is obliged to follow the requirements and guidelines of the service. It is not permitted to register sensitive information about oneself or others, or to use the service for defamatory behaviour.
registered_personal_data.paragraph3: The data controller can store information for statistical purposes, if this is in the interest of society, cf. <0>Data Protection Act §8</0> and <1>GDPR Article 6</1> No. 1 letter e.
registered_personal_data.paragraph4: The following personal data is processed in the service:
registered_personal_data.paragraph5: The information about your activity is stored in order to provide you with user support and to gain insight into the general use of the service.

paragraph6.bullet_point1: The purpose of processing personal data has been fulfilled
paragraph6.bullet_point2: The data controller decides to discontinue the service
paragraph6.intro: Personal data is stored until one of the following events occurs:

registered_personal_data.paragraph7: Logs and backups of system data are stored for up to one year.
registered_personal_data.paragraph8: User information (except logs) is stored for the lifetime of a resource for users who register content in NVA.

row0.col1: Full name and role of author, editor, supervisor and other creator or contributor
row0.col2: Registered in NVA or transferred from external data source

row1.col0: Personal data in the resource itself
row1.col1: Persons identified in the resource. The content of the resource must be quality assured by the responsible party before publication.
row1.col2: The resource is uploaded to NVA upon registration or transferred from an external source

row0.col1: Identities in the service and integrated systems. Feide ID, Author ID, ORCID iD

row1.col0: System roles and affiliation to the institution
row1.col1: The user is assigned roles in the system to provide customized functionality and access to the service.

row2.col1: Information related to the user's interaction with the service. Necessary for customizing functionality in the service and for authenticating users.

row3.col1: A log of system usage related to the logged-in user and/or IP address. The IP address will be registered for anonymous users, which in some cases can be traced back to an individual. The purpose of the log is to maintain the security and integrity of the system, provide user support, and analyse the use of the service. The information collected includes the time, user ID, IP address, information about the browser and hardware, session information, and other information that the browser normally provides.

row1.col1: E-mail address assigned at your own institution.

row2.col1: User's preferences for using the service. Language selection, institutional affiliation.

security_for_personal_data.heading: The security of your personal data.
security_for_personal_data.paragraph0: Personal data in the service is secured with several measures. All transfers to and from the service related to user accounts are encrypted. The data processor regularly performs risk and vulnerability analyses, and tests the security of the service to protect your personal data.
security_for_personal_data.paragraph1: The data controller is responsible for procedures that safeguard privacy in connection with the publication of content.

service_in_brief.heading: Brief summary of the service
service_in_brief.paragraph0: NVA is a service for collecting and making available information about, and results from, Norwegian research. The institution (the data controller) registers and maintains its own content in the service and configures distribution rules for published resources (articles, reports, datasets, etc.). The service also receives content belonging to the institution from other data sources. NVA makes the institution's open content available via open interfaces, with the intention of making this known and searchable to the outside world and to promote indexing in search engines and search portals.
service_in_brief.paragraph1: NVA supports delayed publication of resources. This means that the registration can be completed so that metadata about the resource is published, while the resource does not become openly available until the specified date.
service_in_brief.paragraph2: The service does not allow processing of sensitive personal data.

what_are_personal_data.heading: What is personal data?
what_are_personal_data.paragraph: Personal data is all forms of data, information, details and assessments that can be linked to you as an individual, cf. <0>the Personal Data Act § 2</0> and <1>GDPR Article 5</1> no. 1. The deciding factor as to what constitutes personal data, is whether the information can be linked to a specific person. Data that can not be linked to an individual may still be personal data in cases where it occurs together with other information.

section0.heading: Right to information and access
section0.paragraph0: You have a right to receive information about how your personal data are processed in the service. This privacy statement is intended to give you the information you have a right to receive. You also have the right to see/access your personal data that are registered in the service, and also other personal data that is collected after you have actively logged in. You also have the right to request a copy of your personal data.
section0.paragraph1: The right to access is provided through self-service in the service, where you get access to your own information after logging in. If the service does not provide complete information via the self-service solution, a written request must be made to the data controller's user support to acquire access to additional information.

section1.heading: Right to correction
section1.paragraph0: You have the right to have incorrect personal data about you corrected. You also have the right to have incomplete personal data about you supplemented. If you believe the service shows incorrect or incomplete personal data, please contact the data controller and explain why you believe the personal data is incorrect or incomplete.
section1.paragraph1: Please note that there is a limited possibility to correct information that is distributed via open interfaces.

section2.heading: Right to restrict processing

paragraph0.bullet_point0: Pending the data controller correcting incorrect or incomplete personal data
paragraph0.bullet_point1: If you have submitted an objection to the processing (see below for more details)
paragraph0.bullet_point2: If the personal data are necessary to establish or defend a legal claim
paragraph0.intro: In certain cases, you may have the right to request restrictions on the processing of your personal data. Restricted processing means that the personal data is still stored, but that other processing in the service is restricted. To request restricted processing of personal data, the conditions in the Personal Data Act and <0>GDPR Article 18</0> must be met. You can request restricted processing:

section2.paragraph1: If restricted processing is granted, the data controller will notify you before the restriction is lifted.

section3.heading: Right to erasure
section3.paragraph0: You have the right to demand that we delete personal data about you. If you wish to have your personal data deleted, please contact the data controller. It is important that you explain why you want the personal data to be deleted, and if possible explain which personal data you want to have deleted.
section3.paragraph1: Please be aware that in some cases, legislation provides exemptions from the right to erasure. For example, this will be the case when we process personal data to fulfil a legal obligation, or to safeguard important societal interests such as archiving, research, and statistics. We are unable to delete user information where the user themselves have registered content in NVA without also deleting the registered content.
section3.paragraph2: Please note that there are also limited possibilities to delete personal data that has been distributed via open interfaces.

section4.heading: Right to object

paragraph0.bullet_point0: The legal basis for the processing of personal data is based on legitimate interests, in the public interest, or when exercising public authority.
paragraph0.bullet_point1: Processing of personal data involves direct marketing or profiling.
paragraph0.bullet_point2: Personal data are processed for scientific/historical research or statistics.
paragraph0.intro: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data under certain conditions, defined in <0>GDPR Article 21</0>. This applies if:

section4.paragraph1: The service generally does not meet these conditions, except the processing of author information and in cases where personal data is used for statistics. When used for statistics, personal data will be anonymized.

paragraph2.bullet_point0: If you have a legitimate need to stop the processing, we ask you to contact the data controller — e.g. if you have a need for protection, a confidential address, or similar.
paragraph2.bullet_point1: When you have consented to the processing of personal data, you have a right to withdraw your consent

section5.heading: Right to complain about the processing
section5.paragraph0: If you believe that we have not processed your personal data in a correct and lawful manner, or that we have not managed to fulfil your rights, you have a right to complain about the processing. See our contact details below.
section5.paragraph1: If we do not uphold your complaint, you may file a complaint with the Norwegian Data Protection Authority. The Data Protection Authority is responsible for ensuring that Norwegian enterprises comply with the provisions of the Personal Data Act and GDPR, in the processing of personal data.

affiliation_modal.add_new_affiliation_helper_text: <0>Only institutions that the project has been carried out in collaboration with should be added as affiliation to the project participant.</0> <0>Add affiliation to the project participant by first searching for the institution and any units.</0> <0>If the project participant belongs to multiple different units under the same institution, you must add this as a new affiliation.</0>

project.close_view_description: Unsaved data you have entered will be lost if you close this view. Do you still want to close the view?

error.contributor_already_added_with_same_role: The project participant has already been added with the same role and affiliation.

form.add_financing_description: <0>Add a funding source if the project receives funding.</0><0>All research results linked to the project will inherit funding that is registered on the project.</0>
form.related_projects_description: Add other projects that are related to this project
form.remove_participant_text: Are you sure you want to remove {{name}}?
form.start_with_empty_form_headline: Start in a blank registration form
form.start_with_nfr_financing: Start with funding from the Norwegian research council (NFR)
form.start_with_nfr_financing_details: If you have funding from the Norwegian Research Council, you may start with them and have some fields preregistered

new_project.search_for_project_name_or_placeholder: Search for project name or project leader

contributors.add_new_affiliation_helper_text: <0>Only institutions that the research has been conducted in collaboration with should be added as an affiliation to the contributor.</0> <0>Add affiliation to the contributor by first searching for the institution and possibly the unit.</0> <0>If the contributor belongs to several different units under the same institution, you must add this as a new affiliation.</0>
contributors.confirm_remove_author_text: Are you sure you want to remove {{contributorName}}?
contributors.edit_affiliation_helper_text: <0>Only institutions that the research has been conducted in collaboration with should be added as an affiliation to the contributor.</0> <0>If the affiliation is not correct, change affiliations by entering the correct institution or unit in the text fields</0>
contributors.invalid_role: The contributor must have a role that is valid for this resource type to be shown to other users
contributors.must_select_type_first: You must select a category before you can add contributors.

description.add_project_helper_text: Search for and select the project in the search field to link the result to a project that is already registered in NVA.
description.confirm_remove_vocabulary_text: Are you sure you want to remove vocabulary for {{vocabulary}}?
description.create_project_helper_text: <0>The researcher defines their own projects.</0> <0>A project must have a title, a project leader, a coordinating institution, a start and an end date. A project can have project participants, funders, approvals or research results.</0> <0>If you have an RCN funding, you can establish a project with that as a starting point. You start by looking up your RCN funding, it is added to the project and all mandatory fields are pre-filled, except for the project leader who must be looked up and confirmed.</0> <0>(Similar functionality is planned based on a REC approval. All projects that are to be part of the KBS reporting must have a REC approval that identifies the project as a clinical treatment study.)</0>
description.description_of_content: Description of content. Particularly relevant when registering, for example, artistic development work
description.duplicate_publication_date_warning: There is already a publication with the same title that has been published this year
description.duplicate_title_warning: There is a registration in NVA with the same title. Please cancel the registration if it is the same result that you are trying to register, to avoid creating a duplicate.

funding.funding_helper_text: <0>You can register funding directly on the result. This is particularly relevant if you do not know which project the result is part of, or if the result has other funders than the project it may belong to.</0> <0>If the result is linked to a project, it will inherit all project funding. It is not necessary to enter the same funding twice.</0>
funding.funding_without_project_description: <0>If the research receives funding not associated with a project, then click on "Add funding" and then search for the funder.</0> <0>Do not register funding that is associated with a project. Funding associated with a project is added when you add the project further up the page. If the funding information does not appear, this must be registered to the project in NVA.</0>
funding.nfr_project_search: Search by project name or project leader

description.keywords_helper: Separate keywords with commas or enter
description.npi_disciplines: Scientific field in the Norwegian Publication Indicator
description.project_helper_text: <0>If you register a funding source on a project, the results you link to that project will "inherit" information about funding. This means you don't have to register all funding sources on all the results of the project. If you search for the funding source in NVA, you will get hits on both the project and the results, and reporting to the Research Council or others will include all results.</0> <0>A result can be linked to several projects.</0>

files_and_license.disabled_helper_text: This file is already published with an approved licence. Contact the curator if you wish to edit or delete the file
files_and_license.file_and_license_info: Every file in NVA must have a licence, to inform the reader about what they are allowed to do with the content.
files_and_license.file_publish_date_helper_text: The file is locked until the specified date
files_and_license.files_awaits_approval_one: {{count}} file and selected licence are waiting to be verified
files_and_license.files_awaits_approval_other: {{count}} files and selected licences are waiting to be verified
files_and_license.find_journal_in_channel_register: See information about the journal in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.find_publisher_in_channel_register: See information about the publisher in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.find_series_in_channel_register: See information about the series in the Norwegian Register
files_and_license.follow_institution_rights_policy: I wish to follow the <0>rights policy</0> of my institution.
files_and_license.info_from_channel_register: More information about the selected publication channel
files_and_license.institution_prefers_cc_by: Your institution has a <0>rights policy</0> that recommends CC-BY.
files_and_license.institution_rights_policy_opt_out_instru: If you wish to opt out of the institution's rights policy, you must check if this is possible at your institution. Contact curator support.
files_and_license.mark_if_funder_requires_rrs: If this publication is funded by an actor who requires you to follow RRS (ref. Plan S), then you indicate that here.
files_and_license.no_duplicates: Cannot add "{{fileName}}", because a file with the same name already exists
files_and_license.no_files_or_links_present_in_this_regist: No file or link has been added for the registration
files_and_license.opted_out_of_rrs: You have chosen not to follow the adopted <0>rights policy</0>
files_and_license.resource_has_no_files_or_links: The resource does not have any files or links to publish
files_and_license.resource_is_a_reference: The resource is a reference and has no files or links to publish
files_and_license.version_accepted_helper_text: <0>Accepted version</0>: the author's final revised version after the article has been peer-reviewed, as it was sent to the publisher. This version does not have the publisher's page numbers and graphic style, or any editorial rewrites, that the published version has. This version should be shared in NVA, preferably in pdf format, with a CC-BY licence.
files_and_license.version_accepted_helper_text_metadata_on: <0>Accepted version</0>: the author's last revised version after the article has been peer-reviewed, as sent to the publisher. This version does not have the publisher's page numbers and graphic style, or any editorial rewrites, that the published version has. This version should be shared in NVA, preferably in pdf format, with a CC-BY licence.
files_and_license.version_embargo_helper_text: <0>Embargo/delayed publication date</0>: Most publishers will not allow the author to make the published version of the article openly available until a certain time has passed. The date for permitted publication is normally specified in an author agreement. In some cases, the accepted version may also be subject to a delayed publication date requirement.
files_and_license.version_helper_text: <0>Upload the accepted and/or published version of the article. If the published version of the article is openly available, you do not need to upload the accepted version.</0> <1>The publishing agreement or other formal communication (email) with the editor, which clarifies conditions for delayed publication date (embargo) and licence should be uploaded. <0>Mark such files with "Do not publish"</0></1>.
files_and_license.version_helper_text_metadata_only: Upload the accepted and/or published version of the article and publishing agreements, such as formal contracts or other communication with the editor. A curator at your institution will review the files and ensure that only the files you are allowed to share are shared, and that they have been assigned the correct licences.
files_and_license.version_published_helper_text: <0>Published version</0>: Also known as VOR or the “version of record”. The published version of the article in a journal, in print and/or online. This version will include any editorial improvements such as copy editing, or typesetting, made after the peer review process is complete. It is usually available on a publisher website, in PDF format. The licence is normally decided by the publisher, so the safe option for a licence is “Publisher's conditions”. Many publishers support Open Access and allow use of the CC-BY licence.
files_and_license.version_published_helper_text_metadata_o: <0>Published version</0>: Also known as VOR or the “version of record”. The article as it is presented in a journal, in print and/or online. This version will include any editorial improvements and the publisher's graphic profile, after peer review. Usually available on a publisher's website, in PDF format. The licence is normally determined by the publisher, so the safe choice for licence is "Publisher's terms". However, many publishers support Open Access and allow the use of the CC-BY licence.
files_and_license.version_publishing_agreement_helper_text: <0>The Author Agreement</0> is a contract between a publisher and an artist or author. It specifies matters such as intellectual ownership, where and how the work can be published, payments, liability protection, confidentiality and royalty. This document is of great help to curators when making assessments about licence and publication date (embargo). Such documents will not be visible to others.

<0>Publishing Agreement</0> is a contract between a publisher and an artist or author. It specifies conditions such as intellectual ownership, where and how the work can be published, payments, liability protection, confidentiality and royalty. This document is of great help to curators when making assessments about licence and publication date (embargo). Such documents will not be visible to others.

registration.locked_nvi_field_description: The publication has been approved for this year's NVI reporting. Therefore, you cannot change {{field}}. If the information is incorrect, you must contact the curator to have it changed.
registration.modal_unsaved_changes_description: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to leave this page?

nvi_warning.approval_override_warning: You have changed the publication in such a way that all institutions with co-authors must approve it again to get it included in this year's NVI report.
nvi_warning.confirm_saving_registration: Do you want to save your changes?
nvi_warning.continue_editing_registration: Do you still want to edit the publication?
nvi_warning.registration_is_included_in_nvi: The publication is part of the Norwegian Science Index (NVI)
nvi_warning.reset_nvi_warning: You may change the year, contributors' affiliation(s) to institution(s), category, or publication channel, but curators at all participating institutions must re-approve the publication for the Norwegian Science Index (NVI).

duplicate_warning_modal.check_duplicate: You should not create duplicates in NVA. Check if <0>this publication <0></0></0> is the same result that you have registered.
duplicate_warning_modal.confirm_not_duplicate: Can you confirm that this is not a duplicate?
duplicate_warning_modal.contact_registrator_to_change: If there are errors or omissions in the publication that is registered, you must contact the registrar or contributor in the registration to change it. You cannot publish the same result again in NVA.
duplicate_warning_modal.headline: The result could be a duplicate
duplicate_warning_modal.if_same_press_no_in_box: If this is the same result as your registration, you must press 'NO' in this box to avoid publishing.
duplicate_warning_modal.publication_already_exists: There is already a publication with the same title and year as your registration.

public_page.error_description: The following errors must be corrected before publishing the result:
public_page.error_description_published_result: The registration is published. The following deficiencies must be corrected when editing:
public_page.find_in_channel_registry: Find in the Norwegian register for publishers
public_page.preview_unavailable: Preview not available. Open the file in a suitable program.
public_page.publishing_request_message_about: If you have questions, contact the curator via the message field.
public_page.reject_publish_request_description: <0>Please provide a reason for why the file(s) are being rejected for publication.</0><0>This reason will be stored in NVA and visible to both the registrar and contributors who are associated with the research result.</0><0>When you reject the file(s), they are removed from the presentation page of the research result. You and the registrar can publish them later or delete them by editing the research result.</0>
public_page.request_doi_again: Request a new assessment of DOI allocation.
public_page.request_doi_description: <0>Allocation of a DOI (Digital Object Identifier) means that metadata about the research result is shared internationally; therefore, a curator will review the registration before the DOI is allocated.</0><0>You can attach a message to the curator here.</0>

tasks_panel.approve_publishing_request_description: <0>As a curator, you can approve or reject files with licences for this research result.</0><0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.approve_publish_request)" they will immediately be available to everyone.</0>
tasks_panel.assign_doi_about: In order for others to be able to use the DOI, you must assign it. Metadata must be published.
tasks_panel.confirm_republish_description: Republish the result if it is to be available in NVA. This will cause the result to appear in search results again.
tasks_panel.describe_doi_rejection_reason: You must justify the rejection of the request for a DOI on this research result.
tasks_panel.draft_doi_description: <0>A reserved DOI allows you (and those you share the DOI with) to cite the research result in other work before it is published.</0><1><0>Read more about DOI<0></0></0></1><0>If you want a DOI for this result, click on "{{buttonText}}".</0>
tasks_panel.duplicate_title_description_details: <0>Duplicates should not be created in NVA. Check if the result that has already been published is the same as the result you have registered.</0><0>If the result that is published has errors or omissions, ask the registrar or contributor associated with the result to change it. Do not register and publish a new result with the change as both results will be available in NVA.</0>
tasks_panel.duplicate_title_description_introduction: This registration has the same title and year as this publication:
tasks_panel.edit_publishing_request_description: If any of the files for the publication should not be published, you can change their publication status by editing the registration.
tasks_panel.files_will_soon_be_published: The files will be available for others shortly. Wait a bit before you reload the page to see the status.
tasks_panel.has_rejected_files_publishing_request: <0>Description (metadata) is published and publicly available.</0><0>Curator has rejected the file, and it has been removed from the public view of the research result</0>
tasks_panel.has_reserved_doi: <0>You can share the reserved DOI with those who will cite the result. Lookup via DOI is not possible until the DOI is assigned by the curator.</0><0>The DOI request is sent to the curator when the result is published. You publish the registration in the publishing menu.</0>
tasks_panel.metadata_published_waiting_for_files: Metadata is published and visible to other users, but a curator must approve the files that have been uploaded before they become visible.
tasks_panel.no_access_to_republish: <0>Should the result not have been unpublished</0><0>Contact the editor to have the result republished.</0>
tasks_panel.no_published_files_on_registration: No published files on the result
tasks_panel.no_published_files_on_registration_descr: <0>The result has no published files.</0><0>Check with the registrar if it is correct that the result should not have published files in NVA.</0><0>Do you want to assign a DOI to a result without a file?</0>
tasks_panel.registration_is_published: The registration is published. Metadata is publicly available.
tasks_panel.registration_is_published_with_files: The registration is published. Metadata and file(s) are publicly available.
tasks_panel.registration_is_published_workflow2: <0>The file and licence are approved and public in NVA.</0><0>You are free to change the description of the result, but if you change the file or licence, the registration must be approved again.</0>
tasks_panel.registration_is_published_workflow2_with: <0>You may freely change the description of the result, but any files must be approved before publishing.</0>
tasks_panel.registration_will_soon_be_published: The registration will be published soon. Wait a bit before you reload page to see updated status.
tasks_panel.reject_publishing_request_description_on: <0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.reject_publish_request)", the file will not be published and therefore will not be visible to others. The file will be moved to unpublished.</0><0>If you wish to delete the file, do so in the editing of the research result.</0>
tasks_panel.reject_publishing_request_description_ot: <0>If you choose "$t(registration.public_page.reject_publish_request)", the files will not be published and therefore will not be visible to others. The files will be moved to unpublished.</0><0>If you wish to delete the files, do so in the editing of the research result.</0>
tasks_panel.republish_description: Republish the result if it is to be available in NVA.
tasks_panel.request_doi_description: <0>A DOI (Digital Object Identifier) increases the visibility of the research result and can lead to more citations.</0><1><0>Read more about DOI<0></0></0></1><0>If you want a DOI for this result, click on "{{buttonText}}".</0>
tasks_panel.reserve_doi_confirmation: <0>Only published research results can have a DOI.</0><0>If you need a DOI to correctly cite research results in other research results that are in progress, before it is published, you can reserve a DOI.</0><0>Only you can see the reserved DOI, and it does not lead anywhere until you publish the research result. After publication, your curator is informed that you want a DOI, and must then assign it (or reject it).</0><0>If you are ready to publish, then publish, and select "$t(registration.public_page.request_doi)", instead of reserving a DOI.</0><1>Do you still want to reserve a DOI?</1>
tasks_panel.terminate_result_confirmation: <0>All files and most of the metadata are deleted from the result.</0><0>Only the title, authors with affiliations, channel information, category, publication date, and any persistent identifiers such as DOI and handle will be preserved.</0>
tasks_panel.terminate_result_description: <0>Delete the result if it has been incorrectly registered.</0><0>If the result is deleted, it is not possible to restore the information and files associated with the result.</0>
tasks_panel.waiting_for_rejected_doi: It may take some time before a reserved DOI is removed. Reload the page to check again.
tasks_panel.you_can_publish_everything: You can publish the registration on your own. The content will then be visible to other users.
tasks_panel.you_can_publish_metadata: You can publish metadata yourself, but a curator must approve the files you uploaded before they can be made visible to other users.
tasks_panel.you_can_publish_metadata_files_info: When file(s) and selected licence have been approved by the curator, they will be made public.

registration.registration_doi_validation_message: This result is already published in NVA. If it has errors or omissions, the result must be corrected.
registration.start_with_empty_registration_title: Start in a blank registration form
registration.start_with_link_to_resource_description: Link to the original version if the resource is already published on the Internet
registration.start_with_link_to_resource_title: Start with link to original version
registration.start_with_uploading_file_description: Upload file if the resource isn't published on the Internet

artistic.remove_announcement_description: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from list of announcements?
artistic.remove_music_work_description: Are you sure you want to remove this work?

resource_type.change_registration_type_description: Note that this may result in you losing some data you have entered in cases where existing data is not valid for the new type. Are you sure you want to change the registration type?

chapter.info_anthology: The anthology where the chapter is published must be published first
chapter.info_book_of_abstracts: The abstract collection where the abstract is published must be published first
chapter.info_report: The report where the chapter is published must be published first
chapter.search_for_anthology: Search for the anthology where the chapter is published
chapter.search_for_book_of_abstracts: Search for the book of abstracts where the abstract is published
chapter.search_for_report: Search for the report where the chapter is published

resource_type.click_to_change_resource_type: Click on the selected category to change it
resource_type.duplicate_category_warning: There is already a publication with {{sameFields}} that has been published in this category. If this is the same result that you are trying to register, you must cancel the registration so you do not create duplicates.
resource_type.level: Level in the Norwegian Publication Indicator

media_contribution.name_of_issue_episode: Name of issue, episode, etc. (if relevant)
media_contribution.name_of_series_program: Name of series, program, etc. (if relevant)

nvi.applicable: The publication can be included in the Norwegian Science Index
nvi.channel_not_rated: The publication cannot be included in the Norwegian Science Index since the publication channel is not at level 1 or 2. (The level may be changed before the year's reporting deadline so that the publication can be included in the Norwegian Science Index)

resource_type.protected_degree_type: You do not have access. Contact the institution that awarded you the degree to get it published. If it is foreign, ask for curator support to get help.
resource_type.protected_file_type: Your institution has chosen not to support file upload for this category
resource_type.remove_doi_text:
You can remove the DOI that was used at the start of registration.
Do you want to remove the link to the original DOI?

accept_dataset_terms.contains_personal_data: Does the dataset contain personal data?*
accept_dataset_terms.contains_personal_data_description: Personal data is any information about an identified or identifiable individual. This can be a name, address, phone number, email, picture, sound recording, fingerprint, online identifier, location information, etc.
accept_dataset_terms.contains_sensitive_data: Does the dataset contain other sensitive or confidential data?*
accept_dataset_terms.contains_sensitive_data_description: Sensitive or confidential data is information and data that require protection or shielding, and must be secured against unlawful access and intrusion. This can be personal data, trade secrets, security information, commercial rights, patents, etc.
accept_dataset_terms.dialog_title: To add research data you must first declare if
accept_dataset_terms.further_info: When you click YES or are unsure, you must send a message to support where your curator will clarify the further process to publish the dataset.

research_data.external_link_helper_text: Add external link with related content
research_data.external_link_helper_text_error: Invalid URL. Ensure that the link is complete. Example: https://sikt.no
research_data.no_publications_using_dataset: No publications are using the dataset.
research_data.remove_relation_confirm_text: Do you want to remove this relation?
research_data.search_for_related_dmps: Search for related data management plans
research_data.search_for_related_registrations_helper: Choose from registrations that are published in NVA

resource_type.search_for_channel: Search the ISSN at <0><0></0></0> to ensure the values you register are correct.
resource_type.series_info: If the publication is part of a series

curator_help.already_in_progress: You already have a dialogue with the curator. Save and go to the result via MY PAGE to continue the dialogue there.
curator_help.description: <0>Here you can send a message directly to the curator at your institution.</0><0>The curator can help you register and change published and unpublished research results.</0><0>You will receive a response on MY PAGE, where you can see who your curator(s) are. Curator support can be answered by different curators at your institution.</0>
curator_help.header: Do you need help from a curator?

self_help.description: Do you need help? See if you can solve the problem yourself by looking at the user guides.
self_help.header: Guide to register a research result

search.search_placeholder: Search for title, contributor, abstract, etc.
search.search_project_placeholder: Search for title, project ID, grant ID or participant

nvi.approve_nvi_candidate_description: <0>As curator you can approve or reject a research result for reporting to the NVI</0> <0> If the research result is to be reported, select "{{buttonText}}".</0>
nvi.delete_note_description: Are you sure you want to delete this note?
nvi.message_description: If you need clarification, contact other NVI curators via the message field.
nvi.reject_nvi_candidate_description: If the research result is not to be reported to NVI, select "{{buttonText}}".
nvi.reject_nvi_candidate_modal_text: Please provide a detailed reason for why you reject the NVI-candidate. The reason must contain at least 10 characters.
nvi.reporting_period_closed: The reporting period for this result is closed.
nvi.reporting_period_missing: The reporting period for this result is not open.

tasks.search_placeholder: Search for title, contributor, abstract or similar

unpublish_actions.search_duplicate_facets: Search with DOI, handle or title
unpublish_actions.unpublish_info: The result will no longer be visible to others if you choose to unpublish it. You may republish it later
unpublish_actions.unpublish_not_allowed: <0>You can not unpublish this result, because it has either an uploaded file with an approved licence or has been reported to the Norwegian science index (NVI).</0><0>If you need to unpublish the result, please contact a curator via curator support.</0>
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_detail_1: When a result is unpublished it will not be searchable in NVA, but will still be available when looking up the reference.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_detail_2: Only metadata (no files) will be visible when directly looked up.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_duplicate_citatio: In order for all citations to be continued, you must look up the other registration. Then all citations will still lead to the other version.
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_duplicate_questio: Is there another published version of the same research result?
unpublish_actions.unpublish_registration_reason: Enter a brief explanation for why this research result should no longer be published. The explanation will be displayed on the research result when looking up the reference to the research result.
